edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPMetaAttributes

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPObject
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPMetaAttributes
public class LSPMetaAttributes
extends LSPObject

Represents the "smeta-attributes" element of STARTS 1.0. This is the object with which the back end responds when queried for its meta- attributes. See the STARTS 1.0 specification for the meanings of all properties stored in this class.

The back end developer instantiates this object and returns it from the getMetaAttributes() method of BackEndLSP.

There are getter methods for reading all the attributes after instantiation, but they are rarely used; the framework reads this object using the toXML() method. The StandardQueryProcessor does use some of them.

Constructor Detail

LSPMetaAttributes

public LSPMetaAttributes(java.lang.String source,
                         LSPField[] fieldsSupported,
                         LSPModifier[] modifiersSupported,
                         LSPObject[] fieldModifierCombinations,
                         java.lang.String queryPartsSupported,
                         double[] scoreRange,
                         java.lang.String rankingAlgorithmId,
                         java.lang.String[] tokenizerIdList,
                         java.lang.String sampleDatabaseResults,
                         java.lang.String[] stopWordList,
                         boolean turnOffStopWords,
                         LSPMetaAttributeSet metaAttributeSet)
See the STARTS 1.0 specification for more information about the meanings of these parameters.

Parameters:
source - cannot be null
fieldsSupported - cannot be null
modifiersSupported - cannot be null
fieldModifierCombinations - optional. A List where every even element is a supported LSPField and every odd element is a supported LSPModifier that can be used with the preceding LSPField.
queryPartsSupported - optional
scoreRange - cannot be null. A double array of length 2. The first element is minimum possible score, and the second is maximum.
rankingAlgorithmId - cannot be null
tokenizerIdList - optional
sampleDatabaseResults - cannot be null
stopWordList - cannot be null
turnOffStopWords - true or false.
metaAttributeSet - cannot be null. See the LSPMetaAttributeSet class.
Method Detail

getSource

public java.lang.String getSource()
What "source" (aka subcollection, backendlsp, etc.) this meta-attributes object describes. This should be the same as the result of the getName() method of BackEndLSP.
Returns:
the source name

getFieldModifierCombinations

public LSPObject[] getFieldModifierCombinations()
What field/modifier combinations are supported in the underlying collection
Returns:
an Object[] where every even element is a supported LSPField and every odd element is a supported LSPModifier that can be used with the preceding LSPField.

getQueryPartsSupported

public java.lang.String getQueryPartsSupported()
What query parts are supported in the underlying collection. According the STARTS spec, this is either "R", "F", or "RF". "R" is for ranking and "F" is for filter.
Returns:
what query parts are supported in the underlying collection

getScoreRange

public double[] getScoreRange()
What is the score range of the underlying collection
Returns:
a double array of length 2. The first element is minimum possible score, and the second is maximum.

toXML

public void toXML(XMLWriter writer)
           throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: LSPObject
Defines how an LSPObject can be represented in XML. The implementor of this method should write all XML to the XMLWriter that has been passed in.
Overrides:
